description:
Finns Nebula is an unknown and uncatalogized reflection nebula around the variable star BE Cam (V* BE CAM, HIP 17884) in the constellation Camelopardalis. It has never been photographed before. 
Finns Nebula is a very rare orange-yellow reflection nebula of the Merope type, because it reminds optically strongly of the nebula around the star in the Pleiades.
Because Finns nebula is located around a variable star, its brightness varies periodically analogous to its central star. This makes Finns nebula an extremely rare yellow, variable reflection nebula.
With an extension of 30-40 arc minutes, the reflection nebula is very large, but extremely weak in brightness.

Dossier on the discovery (PDF) for download:
http://www.sternwarte-baerenstein.de/upload/be-cam_reflexionsnebel.pdf (german)
http://www.sternwarte-baerenstein.de/upload/be-cam_reflection_nebula.pdf (english)
title: NEW DISCOVERY: Finn's Nebula, a reflection nebula around the variable star BE Cam
